title: Fans blast Tom Hardy for ruining new BBC drama Taboo with his ‘incoherent mumbling’ and grunting
text:
WE CAN HARDY HEAR IT Fans blast Tom Hardy for ruining new BBC drama Taboo with his ‘incoherent mumbling’ and grunting 
Viewers say the star is impossible to follow as he plays adventurer James Delaney Exclusive by LUCY JONES, Bizarre TV Reporter 21st February 2017, 8:57 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments TOM Hardy has been blasted by fans for ruining BBC1 drama Taboo with “incoherent mumbling” and repeated grunts. 
They say the star, 39, is impossible to follow as he plays adventurer James Delaney in the series. BBC Viewers have complained about being unable to hear Tom Hardy in the drama 
He has also peppered the first seven episodes with 98 pig-like grunts — one every four minutes. 
Last Saturday’s show, watched by 3.5 million, featured 15 of the bizarre snorts as he was tortured in the Tower of London. 
Audience members have slammed the grunt-heavy gothic show for its inaudible dialogue and its lead star’s constant mumbling. BBC The first episode feature 15 bizarre snorts from Hardy’s character 
Thomas Worley blasted on Twitter: “I wish Tom Hardy would speak up a bit sometimes #Taboo.” 
Glen Miller chipped in: “#Taboo, mumble, mumble, mumble. What the effing hell is going on?” 
Meryl Davies said: “Taboo ruined by incoherent mumbling. Could have been brilliant.” All Tom Hardy's grunts and Hmms from the first 5 episodes of the BBC drama Taboo Getty Images - WireImage Fans took to Twitter to complain about the actor 
Megan OJ added: “All I hear Tom Hardy do is grunt.” 
Happy Valley, Rillington Place , Jamaica Inn and Poldark have also come under fire for similar reasons.

This isn't Tom Hardy's only Taboo blow, it emerged last month that he lost a staggering £2million making the drama . 
The actor, 39 , who devised the show and plays the lead role, set up a few firm Taboo Productions Ltd to handle the finances for the eight-part series. 
But new accounts show he was left with a hefty shortfall as an income of £8.4million was unable to match the £10.4million racked up in outgoing costs. 
A source said: “These new figures will make stark reading for Tom. 
“No matter who you are or how much money you’re worth, £2million is a lot of money to simply throw away. BBC 4 The Batman star set up Taboo Productions Limited to finance the show, but high outgoing costs have left him with a shortfall 
“This is the first major TV drama Tom has overseen himself. He has written it, produced it and starred in it, so he was always going to come up against some difficulties.”
